# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/box.py
@source-hash: 9ebe5f608520841f
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:01:57Z

## Purpose
Rich library's box rendering module that provides ASCII and Unicode character sets for drawing table borders and console UI elements. Part of the pip-vendored rich library used for terminal formatting.

## Key Components

### Box Class (L16-189)
Primary class that defines character sets for rendering box borders in tables and panels.

**Constructor** (L33-65): Takes an 8-line string defining all box characters, parses into semantic attributes:
- Line 1: top border chars (top_left, top, top_divider, top_right)
- Line 2: head vertical chars (head_left, head_vertical, head_right) 
- Line 3: head row separator (head_row_left/horizontal/cross/right)
- Line 4: mid vertical chars (mid_left, mid_vertical, mid_right)
- Line 5: body row separator (row_left/horizontal/cross/right)
- Line 6: foot row separator (foot_row_*)
- Line 7: foot vertical chars (foot_left, foot_vertical, foot_right)
- Line 8: bottom border chars (bottom_left, bottom, bottom_divider, bottom_right)

**Key Methods:**
- `substitute()` (L73-89): Platform-aware box substitution for Windows legacy console and ASCII-only modes
- `get_plain_headed_box()` (L91-99): Returns equivalent box without header-specific styling
- `get_top()` (L101-119): Generates top border string for given column widths
- `get_row()` (L121-168): Generates row separator for different levels (head/row/foot/mid)
- `get_bottom()` (L170-188): Generates bottom border string

### Predefined Box Constants (L192-408)
Extensive collection of box styles:
- ASCII variants: ASCII, ASCII2, ASCII_DOUBLE_HEAD (L192-226)
- Unicode square borders: SQUARE, SQUARE_DOUBLE_HEAD (L228-248)
- Minimal styles: MINIMAL, MINIMAL_HEAVY_HEAD, MINIMAL_DOUBLE_HEAD (L250-282)
- Simple horizontal-only: SIMPLE, SIMPLE_HEAD, SIMPLE_HEAVY (L285-317)
- Specialty styles: HORIZONTALS, ROUNDED, HEAVY variants, DOUBLE variants (L320-395)
- MARKDOWN for markdown-compatible tables (L397-407)

### Compatibility Mappings (L410-427)
- `LEGACY_WINDOWS_SUBSTITUTIONS`: Maps Unicode boxes to ASCII equivalents for legacy Windows consoles
- `PLAIN_HEADED_SUBSTITUTIONS`: Maps header-styled boxes to plain equivalents

## Dependencies
- `_loop.loop_last` (L10): Utility for iterating with last-item detection
- `typing_extensions` fallback for Python <3.8 Literal support (L4-7)
- Optional rich console integration for platform detection

## Usage Patterns
Boxes are used by Rich's Table and Panel classes to render borders. The substitute() method provides automatic fallbacks for platform compatibility, while the get_* methods generate actual border strings for rendering.

## Demo Code (L430-480)
Self-contained demonstration that renders all box styles in a grid layout when run as main module.
